places.name: Frederik Meijer Gardens
places.notes: Beautiful gardens and sculptures. On summer nights, they have concerts in the amphitheater. Tuesdays evenings are free.
places.address: Frederik Meijer Gardens and Sculpture Park, 1000, East Beltline Avenue Northeast, Grand Rapids, Kent County, Michigan, 49525, United States

places.name: John Ball Zoo
places.notes: A great zoo with a variety of animals. It's a great place to take kids or just enjoy a day outdoors. Recommended: check out the porcupine - he's a mad lad.
places.parking: Free - Huge lot with plenty of space.
places.address: 1300 West Fulton Street, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Grand Rapids Art Museum
places.notes: A modern art museum with a variety of exhibits. It's a great place to spend an afternoon.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 101 Monroe Center St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Grand Rapids Public Museum
places.notes: A museum with exhibits on the history of Grand Rapids and the surrounding area.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 272 Pearl St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Woodrows Duckpin Bowling
places.notes: A unique bowling experience with duckpin bowling. Games are very short and quick and it's attached in the Amway Grand Hotel.
places.parking: Just walk - it's in the hotel!
places.address: 200 Lyon St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Sixth Street Park
places.notes: A small park with a playground and picnic area. It's a great place to relax and enjoy the outdoors right on the edge of downtown. There is a dam here that you'll likely see fisherman at. PLEASE NOTE: THE RAPIDS ARE VERY STRONG HERE AND REGARDED AS AN EXTREMLY DANGEROUS DAM. But there are fish there....
places.parking: A parking lot is available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 647 Monroe Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: More or Less - alcohol-free bottle shop
places.notes: A unique shop offering a variety of alcohol-free beverages. It's a great place to find non-alcoholic options for those who prefer them. Their selection is the best in the city BY FAR and the staff is super friendly and ready with a recommendation. Cannabis drinks can be found here as well, and they are rare in the city. Recommendation from Joe: Try the DROM (they have some for tasting).
places.address: 434 Leonard St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Big Mini Putt Club
places.notes: A fun indoor mini golf course with a variety of holes. It's a great place for groups of 2-5 to chill out.
places.address: 70 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Gimme's Par and Grill
places.notes: An indoor golf simulator and grill. I have not been here, but it comes highly recommended by a friend.
places.address: 45 Ottawa Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Grand Rapids Children's Museum
places.notes: A fun and interactive museum for kids. It's a great place to take children and let them explore and learn.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 11 Sheldon Ave NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
